greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of permutations of [1..n] with k modular progressions of rise 2, distance 1 and length 3 (n >= 0, k >= 0).
reference: Wayne M. Dymacek, Isaac Lambert and Kyle Parsons, Arithmetic Progressions in Permutations, http://math.ku.edu/~ilambert/CN.pdf, 2012.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..18, flattened
maple: b:= proc(s, x, y, n) option remember; expand(`if`(s={}, 1, add(
`if`(x>0 and irem(n+x-y, n)=2 and irem(n+y-j, n)=2, z, 1)*
b(s minus {j}, y, j, n), j=s)))
T:= n-> (p-> seq(coeff(p, z, i), i=0..max(0,
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Sep 15 2012
ext: More terms from _Alois P. Heinz_, Apr 13 2021
